file_content.text: The Eighty-third Platoon will always be at your service, my lord.
I'm grateful for your help, sir. I trust you'll keep the details of our mission classified.
You performed admirably for the Empire. You should consider a career in the military.
I'm grateful Lieutenant Herral and his men didn't die in vain. Thank you for recovering that stolen data card.
Captain Labe, Eighty-third Platoon. I'll do my best to serve, my lord, though my resources are limited.
Captain Labe, Eighty-third Platoon, sir. Unless this is an official visit, I'll have to ask you to wait.
Captain Labe, Eighty-third Platoon. I don't normally work with mercenaries, but I'm willing to pay for some extra eyes and ears right now.
You there. I'm Captain Labe, Eighty-third Platoon. I could use your assistance.
One of my squads disappeared while returning from an important mission. I'm mounting a search-and-rescue operation.
A holorecording from your squad leader directed me here, Captain.
Lieutenant Herral sent me.
Holorecording? I don't understand.
The situation is under control, Captain. I finished the mission your men started.
I already did their job.
Finished? You don't even know the details of our mission.
Forget the search and rescue. The mission's over.
No need for that.
How would you know that? Our mission is classified.
Wait... that data card you're holding. I recognize those markings. That's the security codes the traitors stole.
I sent Lieutenant Herral's squad to recover that. They're... they didn't make it, did they?
They were ambushed and slaughtered by a Republic patrol.
No, they didn't.
They fought bravely, but they were outnumbered by Republic forces.
It wasn't their fault.
Republic troops made short work of your crack team.
Obviously not.
I served with Lieutenant Herral for six years. This must not stand.
It's time to burn every Republic outpost to the ground. Show those dogs how the Eighty-third Platoon avenges its fallen.
I'll organize what's left of my command and drive those scum off Balmorra by myself, if I have to.
Hatred will win this war.
Yes--to battle!
When I tell the men, we'll have all the hate we need.
Lieutenant Herral stood his ground when he should've retreated.
Don't be a fool.
Herral was one of the best I've served with... but you're right. We need a solid plan of attack.
It's good you retrieved that data card. If the resistance had cracked our security codes, their saboteurs and commandos could've struck where we're most vulnerable.
If the resistance had any courage, they'd face us in open battle.
Those cowards.
They don't have the spine for that. Neither does the Republic.
Perhaps this data card might be safer with me?
It sounds quite useful.
That's, ahem, very probably true, my lord. However, I've already signaled central command to come get it.
The resistance will certainly make another attempt to steal this data card.
Tighten your security.
They won't get another chance at the security codes--I'll see to that.
Spare me the pretty speeches. I did this for the reward.
I don't care about that.
Of course. You're a mercenary, after all.
I always protect the Empire.
You've done the Eighty-third Platoon--and the Empire--a great honor.
Your thanks isn't enough.
Everything my unit can spare is yours.
I wish I could offer a greater reward, but I'm afraid this will have to do.
You've inspired us to take action, my lord. Those Republic scum will suffer for what they've done.
I'd better start gathering my men, sir. I think a frontal assault might take those Republic dogs by surprise.
I'd invite you to join my men assaulting the Republic outpost, but this is a score we need to settle personally.
Excuse me, but I need to rally the men. We've got a score to settle with the Republic.
I should file a report with central command. I appreciate your wise counsel, my lord. Good day.
I'm going to request reinforcements from central command. Thanks for the strategic advice, sir.
You have a head for battle strategy, mercenary. Thanks for helping me keep mine.
I appreciate all your help--and your advice. Stay safe out there.
Excuse me, my lord, but I'm overseeing a vital mission.
Apologies, sir, but I'm busy directing a classified operation.
If you're looking for work, we're not hiring any mercenaries.
Excuse me, but I'm monitoring an important mission.
